p.br: Our mission is to prepare students to be responsible citizens and lifelong learners.

p.span: Coming together as ONE, we are South O'Brien.

li.class: menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-home current-menu-item page_item page-item-1367 current_page_item menu-item-1835

li.a: Information from Elementary Teachers during closure

img.p: Our mission is to prepare students to be responsible citizens and lifelong learners.
Our mission is to prepare students to be responsible citizens and lifelong learners.

a.p: Critical Goal Areas: Academics, Character Education, Community Unity, Facilities, and Fiscal Responsibility

img.p:
Academics, Character Education,
Community Unity, Facilities, and
Fiscal Responsibility

div.p: Academic achievement is South O’Brien’s top priority and we believe that extracurricular involvement will grow each individual beyond the learning in the classroom. Learn more …
To quickly find information on our website, use the Search box in the upper right corner. Then choose from possible choices to go directly to that page.
Check in each day to the Announcements page for updates to the daily events and happenings at all grade levels. Some announcements are intended to provide information to interested family members.
Students entering grades 9-12 for the 2020-21 school year need to register for classes by April 26. Registration Information

hr.p: (Updated on April 17.) Schools in Iowa will not reopen this school year. Teachers will continue to contact students regularly about academic work during the school closure period. More information will be posted after school officials have had time to make plans.
South O’Brien Little Paws Preschool Registration – has been postponed. New date to be determined.
Please visit the Employment page for open positions.

div.div: Click on the What’s New link above for special announcements and information.
div.p: Check out the Wolverine Gallery for pictures of students in activities and classrooms at South O’Brien.
Visit our Facebook page or Twitter feed for information about students and events at South O’Brien.

div.class: vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_custom_1469164227910 vc_custom_1469164227910

div.h5: Annual Notice of Non-Discrimination Policy Statement
div.p: The South O’Brien Community School District offers career and technical programs in the following service areas: • Agricultural, Food, and Natural Resources • Applied Science, Technology, Engineering, and Manufacturing • Business, Finance, Marketing, and Management • Human Services It is the policy of the South O’Brien Community School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact the district’s Equity Coordinator, Dan Moore, Superintendent, 216 S Rutledge Street-PO Box 638, Paullina, Iowa 51046, 712-949-2115, dmoore@soswolverines.org.
